next_steps.note: "Define the scope of the network scanning project: Identify target networks (e.g., home network, specific IP range, public websites) and the types of scans to be performed (e.g., ping sweep, port scan, vulnerability scan).",
"Research and select a network scanning tool: Evaluate options like Nmap, Masscan, or Zenmap, considering factors like features, ease of use, and operating system compatibility.",
"Set up a testing environment: Create a safe and isolated environment (e.g., virtual machine, lab network) to test the scanning tool and avoid unintended consequences on live networks.",
"Develop a basic scan script/command: Create a simple script or command-line instruction using the chosen tool to perform a basic ping sweep or port scan on the testing environment.",

"Document initial findings and refine the scan scope: After the initial scan, document the results and adjust the scan scope based on the findings.  Specifically note any unexpected devices or open ports."
